title: Who is the best guitarist Chet Atkins or Jimi Hendrix? - Quora

response.answer_text: Two extremely gifted guitar players on the “Mount Rushmore” of American guitar players. Chet with his long tenured career as The Greatest Country picker (while also heading up RCA’s Nashville Division for over 20 years). And the meteoric James Marshall Hendrix, considered by many the Father of not only Psychedelic Rock but also the first real “modern” electric guitar player. Worlds apart, but highly influential cats. Jimi did his in 4–5 years while Chet had a nice long career of over 50 years. We called him ‘Mr.Guitar’ and ‘The Country Gentleman’, but Chet never got credited for being a real fan of Jazz, Blues, and Rock music (which he was). Many Americans don’t know that he was also a gifted Flamenco guitarist! So much so, that in some South American countries, he is known for his Flamenco guitar playing and not his Country picking!  above: from 1975, Atkins plays Scott Joplin’s “The Entertainer” on TV. Chet is credited as being one of the first real proponents of the Modern Country sound. His guitar playing, production skills, and music business savvy, literally rescued Country Music from being considered “irrelevant” to music fans in the 1960’s. Atkins helped create the Nashville Sound, and never received the props for that. Nor did he get credit for introducing Waylon Jennings, Willie Nelson, Dolly Parton, and Jerry Reed to Country music fans.Jimi will always be known for taking what he learned on the “Chitlin’ Circuit” as a backing musician, dressing it up in psychedelic clothes, and turning it up to “11”. He took London by storm, and then the rest of the world. His debut album, “Are You Experienced?” by the Jimi Hendrix Experience, is considered one of the greatest debut albums ever! And many people still consider his version of ‘The Star Spangled Banner’ at Woodstock in 1969, the finest (and final) moment of the 60’s Flower Power Movement. Jimi introduced many firsts to Pop culture, and his death at 27 was considered a real loss to Rock music lovers worldwide. After all is said and done, I like Chet Atkins better in another apples to oranges question. I think his 14 Grammy Awards and 50 years of playing are tops in our lifetime.

Chet set the standard that Willie Nelson and others (Roy Clark for ex. is one I recall as a boy) have tried to match. Delta Bluesmen like Howlin’ Wolf (with Hubert Sumlin on lead guitar) set a new standard with the ‘Chicago electric blues’ … Eric Clapton improved on Wolf’s standard, which most-all rockers have tried to match ever since. Then there’s Jimi … he took the Clpton standard andi launched it into the psychedelic stratosphere … and only a few guys like Steve Ray Vaughn could tae a ride on that rocket … (Wolf’s Killing Floor … a reference to the beaf slaughterhouse, as a crude metaphor for a man-woman relationship)  (And Hendrix’s version of it…)
